1225            "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1226            "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1227            "const vec3 sRGBFrom = vec3(2.4);\n" +
1228            "const vec3 sRGBThresholdFrom = vec3(0.04045);\n" +
1229            "const vec3 sRGBTo = vec3(1.0 / 2.4);\n" +
1230            "const vec3 sRGBThresholdTo = vec3(0.0031308);\n" +
1231            "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.00885645);\n" +
1232            "vec3 linear(vec3 t){ return mix(pow((t + 0.055) * (1.0 / 1.055), sRGBFrom), t * (1.0/12.92), step(t, sRGBThresholdFrom)); }\n" +
1233            "vec3 sRGB(vec3 t){ return mix(1.055 * pow(t, sRGBTo) - 0.055, 12.92*t, step(t, sRGBThresholdTo)); }\n" +
1234            "float xyzF(float t){ return mix(pow(t,1./3.), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, 0.00885645)); }\n" +
1235            "vec3 xyzF(vec3 t){ return mix(pow(t, forward), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon)); }\n" +
1236            "float xyzR(float t){ return mix(t*t*t , 0.1284185 * (t - 0.139731), step(t, 0.20689655)); }\n" +
1237            "vec3 rgb2lab(vec3 c)\n" +
1238            "{\n" +
1239            "    c *= mat3(0.4124, 0.3576, 0.1805,\n" +
1240            "              0.2126, 0.7152, 0.0722,\n" +
1241            "              0.0193, 0.1192, 0.9505);\n" +
1242            "    c = xyzF(c);\n" +
1243            "    vec3 lab = vec3(max(0.,1.16*c.y - 0.16), (c.x - c.y) * 5.0, (c.y - c.z) * 2.0); \n" +
1244            "    return lab;\n" +
1245//            "    return vec3(lab.x, length(vec2(lab.y,lab.z)), atan(lab.z, lab.y));\n" +
1246            "}\n" +
1247            "vec3 lab2rgb(vec3 c)\n" +
1248            "{\n" +
1249//            "    c = vec3(c.x, cos(c.z) * c.y, sin(c.z) * c.y);\n" +
1250            "    float lg = 1./1.16*(c.x + 0.16);\n" +
1251            "    vec3 xyz = vec3(xyzR(lg + c.y * 0.2),\n" +
1252            "                    xyzR(lg),\n" +
1253            "                    xyzR(lg - c.z * 0.5));\n" +
1254            "    vec3 rgb = xyz*mat3( 3.2406, -1.5372,-0.4986,\n" +
1255            "                        -0.9689,  1.8758, 0.0415,\n" +
1256            "                         0.0557, -0.2040, 1.0570);\n" +
1257            "    return rgb;\n" +
1258            "}\n" +
1259            "void main()\n" +
1260            "{\n" +
1261            "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1262            "  vec3 lab = rgb2lab(linear(tgt.rgb));\n" +
1263            "  lab.x = lab.x + v_color.r - 0.5372549;\n" +
1264            "  lab.yz = lab.yz + (v_color.gb - 0.5) * 2.0;\n" +
1265            "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sRGB(clamp(lab2rgb(lab), 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1266            "}";
1267
1268    /**
1269     * Makes the colors in the given textures almost-grayscale, then moves their chromatic channels much closer to the
1270     * batch color, without changing the lightness. The result is almost all the same hue as the batch color, and can be
1271     * gray if the batch color is any grayscale color. This uses an RGB batch color for simpler usage in most code that
1272     * doesn't already use colorful-gdx. There is some contribution from the original texture, so even if the batch
1273     * color is gray, then the result will probably have some very muted colors. I hope this shader is... bearable.
1274     * <br>
1275     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1276     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1277     * <br>
1278     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1279     */
1280    public static String fragmentShaderColorize =
1281            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1282                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1283                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1284                    "#else\n" +
1285                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1286                    "#endif\n" +
1287                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1288                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1289                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1290                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1291                    "void main()\n" +
1292                    "{\n" +
1293                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1294                    "  vec3 base = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1295                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1296                    "              * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1297                    "  vec3 tint = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1298                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1299                    "              * (v_color.rgb * v_color.rgb), forward);\n" +
1300                    "  tint.x = clamp(base.x, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1301                    "  float blen = length(base.yz);\n" +
1302                    "  blen *= blen;\n" +
1303                    "  tint.yz = clamp(tint.yz * (0.7 + blen) + base.yz * (0.3 - blen), -1.0, 1.0);\n" + // change 0.7 and 0.3 to, say, 0.85 and 0.15 to reduce the original image's contribution
1304                    "  tint = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * tint;\n" +
1305                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1306                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1307                    "                 (tint * tint * tint)," +
1308                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1309                    "}";
1310
1311    /**
1312     * Makes the colors in the given textures almost-grayscale, then moves their chromatic channels much closer to the
1313     * batch color's chromatic channels, without changing the lightness. The result is almost all the same hue as the
1314     * batch color, and can be gray if the batch color is any grayscale color. The lightness of the batch color is used
1315     * to determine how strong the effect should be; you may want to use an out-of-gamut color for very strong tint
1316     * effects, because those need to be light and the lightest gamut is just one point. This uses an Oklab batch color.
1317     * There is some contribution from the original texture, varied based on the batch lightness, so even if the batch
1318     * color is gray, then the result will probably have some very muted colors.
1319     * <br>
1320     * You can generate Oklab colors using any of various methods in the {@code oklab} package, such as
1321     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.oklab.ColorTools#oklab(float, float, float, float)}.
1322     * <br>
1323     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1324     */
1325    public static String fragmentShaderColorizeOklab =
1326            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1327                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1328                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1329                    "#else\n" +
1330                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1331                    "#endif\n" +
1332                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1333                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1334                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1335                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1336                    "void main()\n" +
1337                    "{\n" +
1338                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1339                    "  vec3 base = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1340                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1341                    "              * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1342                    "  vec2 tint = v_color.gb - 0.5;\n" +
1343                    "  base.x = clamp(base.x, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1344                    "  float blen = length(base.yz);\n" +
1345                    "  blen *= blen;\n" +
1346                    "  base.gb = clamp(tint * (v_color.r + blen) + base.yz * (1.0 - v_color.r - blen), -1.0, 1.0);\n" +
1347                    "  base = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * base;\n" +
1348                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1349                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1350                    "                 (base * base * base)," +
1351                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1352                    "}";
1353    /**
1354     * The simplest possible color-inverting shader for a SpriteBatch, this just takes each RGB channel and subtracts it
1355     * from 1.0 to get the value this uses. This uses an RGBA batch color.
1356     * <br>
1357     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1358     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1359     * <br>
1360     * Meant only for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1361     */
1362    public static final String fragmentShaderInvertedRGB =
1363            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1364                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1365                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1366                    "#else\n" +
1367                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1368                    "#endif\n" +
1369                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1370                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1371                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1372                    "void main()\n" +
1373                    "{\n" +
1374                    "   vec4 tgt = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords);\n" +
1375                    "   gl_FragColor = vec4(1.0 - tgt.rgb * v_color.rgb, v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1376                    "}";
1377
1378    /**
1379     * Just like {@link #fragmentShaderInvertedRGB}, but internally converts to Oklab, so it can invert just lightness
1380     * without changing color hue or saturation. This uses an RGBA batch color.
1381     * <br>
1382     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1383     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1384     * <br>
1385     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1386     */
1387    public static String fragmentShaderInvertedLightness =
1388            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1389                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1390                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1391                    "#else\n" +
1392                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1393                    "#endif\n" +
1394                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1395                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1396                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1397                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1398                    "float toOklab(float L) {\n" +
1399                    "        const float shape = 0.64516133, turning = 0.95;\n" +
1400                    "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
1401                    "        float r = mix(\n" +
1402                    "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
1403                    "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
1404                    "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
1405                    "        return r * r;\n" +
1406                    "}\n" +
1407                    "float fromOklab(float L) {\n" +
1408                    "        const float shape = 1.55, turning = 0.95;\n" +
1409                    "        L = sqrt(L);\n" +
1410                    "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
1411                    "        return mix(\n" +
1412                    "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
1413                    "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
1414                    "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
1415                    "}\n" +
1416//                    "float toOklab(float L) {\n" +
1417//                    "  return (L - 1.0) / (1.0 - L * 0.4285714) + 1.0;\n" +
1418//                    "}\n" +
1419//                    "float fromOklab(float L) {\n" +
1420//                    "  return (L - 1.0) / (1.0 + L * 0.75) + 1.0;\n" +
1421//                    "}\n" +
1422                    "void main()\n" +
1423                    "{\n" +
1424                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords ) * v_color;\n" +
1425                    "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1426                    "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1427                    "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1428                    "  lab.x = fromOklab(1.0 - toOklab(lab.x));\n" +
1429                    "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n" +
1430                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1431                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1432                    "                 (lab * lab * lab)," +
1433                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), tgt.a);\n" +
1434                    "}";
1435
1436    /**
1437     * Just like {@link #fragmentShaderInvertedLightness}, but instead of inverting lightness, this tries to change only
1438     * hue, without changing lightness or (generally) saturation. This works internally by negating the A and B
1439     * components of the color (as Oklab). This uses an RGBA batch color.
1440     * <br>
1441     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1442     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1443     * <br>
1444     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1445     */
1446    public static String fragmentShaderInvertedChroma =
1447            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1448                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1449                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1450                    "#else\n" +
1451                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1452                    "#endif\n" +
1453                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1454                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1455                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1456                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1457                    "void main()\n" +
1458                    "{\n" +
1459                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords ) * v_color;\n" +
1460                    "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1461                    "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1462                    "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1463                    "  lab.yz = -lab.yz;\n" +
1464                    "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n" +
1465                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1466                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1467                    "                 (lab * lab * lab)," +
1468                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), tgt.a);\n" +
1469                    "}";
1470    /**
1471     * This is similar to the default vertex shader from libGDX, but also does some expensive setup work for HSLuv batch
1472     * colors per-vertex instead of per-fragment. It is needed if you use {@link #fragmentShaderHsluv}.
1473     */
1474    public static final String vertexShaderHsluv =
1475            "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1476            + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1477            + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
1478            + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
1479            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
1480            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
1481            +
1482            "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.0088564516790356308);\n" +
1483            "const float kappa = 9.032962962;\n" +
1484            "const mat3 m =" +
1485            "         mat3(+3.240969941904521, -1.537383177570093, -0.498610760293000,\n" +
1486            "              -0.969243636280870, +1.875967501507720, +0.041555057407175,\n" +
1487            "              +0.055630079696993, -0.203976958888970, +1.056971514242878);\n" +
1488            "float intersectLength (float sn, float cs, float line1, float line2) {\n" +
1489            "    return line2 / (sn - line1 * cs);\n" +
1490            "}\n" +
1491            "float chromaLimit(float hue, float lightness) {\n" +
1492            "        float sn = sin(hue);\n" +
1493            "        float cs = cos(hue);\n" +
1494            "        float sub1 = (lightness + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
1495            "        sub1 *= sub1 * sub1;\n" +
1496            "        float sub2 = sub1 > epsilon.x ? sub1 : lightness / kappa;\n" +
1497            "        float mn = 1.0e20;\n" +
1498            "        vec3 ms = m[0] * sub2;\n" +
1499            "        float msy, top1, top2, bottom, length;\n" +
1500            "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1501            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1502            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1503            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1504            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1505            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1506            "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1507            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1508            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1509            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1510            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1511            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1512            "        ms = m[1] * sub2;\n" +
1513            "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1514            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1515            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1516            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1517            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1518            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1519            "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1520            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1521            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1522            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1523            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1524            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1525            "        ms = m[2] * sub2;\n" +
1526            "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1527            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1528            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1529            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1530            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1531            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1532            "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1533            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1534            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1535            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1536            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1537            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1538            "        return mn;\n" +
1539            "}\n" +
1540            "vec3 hsl2luv(vec3 c)\n" +
1541            "{\n" +
1542            "    float L = c.z;\n" +
1543            "    float C = chromaLimit(c.x, L) * c.y;\n" +
1544            "    float U = cos(c.x) * C;\n" +
1545            "    float V = sin(c.x) * C;\n" +
1546            "    return vec3(L, U, V);\n" +
1547            "}\n"
1548            + "void main()\n"
1549            + "{\n"
1550            + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1551            + "   v_color.w = v_color.w * (255.0/254.0);\n"
1552            + "   v_color.x *= 6.2831;\n"
1553            + "   v_color.rgb = hsl2luv(v_color.rgb);\n"
1554            + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
1555            + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1556            + "}\n";
1557
1558    /**
1559     * Just like {@link #fragmentShaderOklab}, but uses the HSLuv color space instead of the Oklab one.
1560     * This also gamma-corrects the inputs and outputs, though it uses subtly different math internally.
1561     * <br>
1562     * You can generate HSLuv colors using any of various methods in the {@code hsluv} package, such as
1563     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.hsluv.ColorTools#hsluv(float, float, float, float)}.
1564     * <br>
1565     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShaderHsluv}.
1566     */
1567    public static String fragmentShaderHsluv =
1568            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1569                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1570                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1571                    "#else\n" +
1572                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1573                    "#endif\n" +
1574                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1575                    "varying vec4 v_color;\n" +
1576                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1577                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1578                    "const vec3 sRGBFrom = vec3(2.4);\n" +
1579                    "const vec3 sRGBThresholdFrom = vec3(0.04045);\n" +
1580                    "const vec3 sRGBTo = vec3(1.0 / 2.4);\n" +
1581                    "const vec3 sRGBThresholdTo = vec3(0.0031308);\n" +
1582                    "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.0088564516790356308);\n" +
1583                    "const float kappa = 9.032962962;\n" +
1584                    "const vec2 refUV = vec2(0.19783000664283681, 0.468319994938791);\n" +
1585                    "const mat3 m =" +
1586                    "         mat3(+3.240969941904521, -1.537383177570093, -0.498610760293000,\n" +
1587                    "              -0.969243636280870, +1.875967501507720, +0.041555057407175,\n" +
1588                    "              +0.055630079696993, -0.203976958888970, +1.056971514242878);\n" +
1589                    "const mat3 mInv =\n" +
1590                    "         mat3(0.41239079926595948 , 0.35758433938387796, 0.180480788401834290,\n" +
1591                    "              0.21263900587151036 , 0.71516867876775593, 0.072192315360733715,\n" +
1592                    "              0.019330818715591851, 0.11919477979462599, 0.950532152249660580);\n" +
1593                    "vec3 linear(vec3 t){ return mix(pow((t + 0.055) * (1.0 / 1.055), sRGBFrom), t * (1.0/12.92), step(t, sRGBThresholdFrom)); }\n" +
1594                    "vec3 sRGB(vec3 t){ return mix(1.055 * pow(t, sRGBTo) - 0.055, 12.92*t, step(t, sRGBThresholdTo)); }\n" +
1595                    "float xyzF(float t){ return mix(pow(t,1./3.), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon.x)); }\n" +
1596                    "vec3 xyzF(vec3 t){ return mix(pow(t, forward), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon)); }\n" +
1597                    "float xyzR(float t){ return mix(t*t*t , 0.1284185 * (t - 0.139731), step(t, 0.20689655)); }\n" +
1598                    "float intersectLength (float sn, float cs, float line1, float line2) {\n" +
1599                    "    return line2 / (sn - line1 * cs);\n" +
1600                    "}\n" +
1601                    "float chromaLimit(float hue, float lightness) {\n" +
1602                    "        float sn = sin(hue);\n" +
1603                    "        float cs = cos(hue);\n" +
1604                    "        float sub1 = (lightness + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
1605                    "        sub1 *= sub1 * sub1;\n" +
1606                    "        float sub2 = sub1 > epsilon.x ? sub1 : lightness / kappa;\n" +
1607                    "        float mn = 1.0e20;\n" +
1608                    "        vec3 ms = m[0] * sub2;\n" +
1609                    "        float msy, top1, top2, bottom, length;\n" +
1610                    "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1611                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1612                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1613                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1614                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1615                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1616                    "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1617                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1618                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1619                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1620                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1621                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1622                    "        ms = m[1] * sub2;\n" +
1623                    "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1624                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1625                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1626                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1627                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1628                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1629                    "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1630                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1631                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1632                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1633                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1634                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1635                    "        ms = m[2] * sub2;\n" +
1636                    "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1637                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1638                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1639                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1640                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1641                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1642                    "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1643                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1644                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1645                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1646                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1647                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1648                    "        return mn;\n" +
1649                    "}\n" +
1650                    "vec3 rgb2luv(vec3 c)\n" +
1651                    "{\n" +
1652                    "    c *= mInv;" +
1653                    "    float L = max(0.,1.16*pow(c.y, 1.0 / 3.0) - 0.16);\n" +
1654                    "    vec2 uv;\n" +
1655                    "    if(L < 0.0001) uv = vec2(0.0);\n" +
1656                    "    else uv = 13. * L * (vec2(4., 9.) * c.xy / (c.x + 15. * c.y + 3. * c.z) - refUV);\n" +
1657                    "    return vec3(L, uv);\n" +
1658                    "}\n" +
1659                    "float forwardLight(float L) {\n" +
1660                    "        const float shape = 0.8528, turning = 0.1;\n" +
1661                    "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
1662                    "        return mix(\n" +
1663                    "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
1664                    "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
1665                    "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
1666                    "}\n" +
1667                    "float reverseLight(float L) {\n" +
1668                    "        const float shape = 1.1726, turning = 0.1;\n" +
1669                    "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
1670                    "        return mix(\n" +
1671                    "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
1672                    "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
1673                    "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
1674                    "}\n" +
1675                    "vec3 luv2rgb(vec3 c)\n" +
1676                    "{\n" +
1677                    "    float L = reverseLight(c.x);\n" +
1678                    "    float U = c.y;\n" +
1679                    "    float V = c.z;\n" +
1680                    "    float lim = chromaLimit(atan(V, U), L);\n" +
1681                    "    float len = length(vec2(U,V));\n" +
1682                    "    if(len > lim) {\n" +
1683                    "      lim /= len;\n" +
1684                    "      U *= lim;\n" +
1685                    "      V *= lim;\n" +
1686                    "    }\n" +
1687                    "    if (L <= 0.0001) {\n" +
1688                    "        return vec3(0.0);\n" +
1689                    "    } else if(L >= 0.9999) {\n" +
1690                    "        return vec3(1.0);\n" +
1691                    "    } else {\n" +
1692                    "      if (L <= 0.08) {\n" +
1693                    "        c.y = L / kappa;\n" +
1694                    "      } else {\n" +
1695                    "        c.y = (L + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
1696                    "        c.y *= c.y * c.y;\n" +
1697                    "      }\n" +
1698                    "    }\n" +
1699                    "    float iL = 1. / (13.0 * L);\n" +
1700                    "    float varU = U * iL + refUV.x;\n" +
1701                    "    float varV = V * iL + refUV.y;\n" +
1702                    "    c.x = 2.25 * varU * c.y / varV;\n" +
1703                    "    c.z = (3. / varV - 5.) * c.y - (c.x / 3.);\n" +
1704                    "    vec3 rgb = c * m;\n" +
1705                    "    return rgb;\n" +
1706                    "}\n" +
1707                    "void main()\n" +
1708                    "{\n" +
1709                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1710                    "  vec3 luv = rgb2luv(linear(tgt.rgb));\n" +
1711                    "  luv.x = forwardLight(clamp(luv.x + v_color.x - 0.5372549, 0.0, 1.0));\n" +
1712                    "  luv.yz = (luv.yz) + (v_color.yz);\n" +
1713                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sRGB(clamp(luv2rgb(luv), 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1714                    "}";
1715}
